post_info.post_title: Has DamEtel committed offenses worthy of being banned?

You have not been hard enough or had strong enough language. Of course all the conservatives will vote against you.

Just about every time I log in I have a new Private Message from Admin warning me about my conduct, and saying that I am going to be banned. I am curious concerning what the views of others here are on this matter.

 I think you need to share, I don't get any threats about being banned emoticon_xangel
I've been threatened with the same thing. I guess it's the Atheist thing.
Wow look at the voting so far not one conservative voteing no.
After reading another thread where a word commonly used in conversation and other forum posts to define absolute control has been banned from one particular subject, I'm not surprised.

No. This is a forum for debates between grown men and women who should be able to stand up for themselves. If people object to your robustness, they have the right to ignore you (though coming to a public discussion forum and then putting some views on ignore always seems bizarre to me); but no-one should demand that other posters be silenced.
 
 Forum admin, of course, have legal as well as free-speech issues to consider; but I don't recall your expressing any libellous or defamatory views.
The two votes for yes? Easyrider and Bassman. What a surprise. Not.
Did you post this thread in the religion's section for any particular reason? emoticon_wow

Well I know I've been looking around for a different forum because of some of the same reasons DamEtel cited, i.e. "Just about every time I log in I have a new Private Message from Admin warning me about my conduct, and saying that I am going to be banned." I don't get quite that many warnings, but if a group who hates the message of Christ and those who bring it flood Admin with enough complaints about every little thing, then the warnings come regardless. 
 
 I've been told me and my God can go straight to hell, been called along with my brethren Christianazis, been told I should be out killing gays, been called all kinds of names, and been defamed almost every which way I know of. Many of these posts, and all of the posters, remain, and Admin has told me he doesn't have time to keep up with these and all the complaints on both sides. Not that I'm totally innocent myself, but it just gets tiresome. 
 
 So, I have found a few different forums I am going to post in instead of this one. I'll probably be banned now for this or given yet another warning, but I tire of it. If my Christian brethren would like a link to the new forum, send me a PM (that is, if I'm still around after this).

if a group who hates the message of Christ and those who bring it flood Admin with enough complaints about every little thing, then the warnings come regardless.

 
 Democracy at work.

Phunting, I tried to return you PM but either it's not working or it's been disabled - curious....  
 
 Thank you for your remarks and I appreciate what you said, about sticking around, etc. And I appreciate that you have been reasonable and not out of line in your postings. Things do get heated sometimes.
 
 Thanks...

Did you post this thread in the religion's section for any particular reason? emoticon_wow

 
 Yes.
 
 I have posted in several other forums at his site (Creation/Evolution, Science, Education, etc.), but it is my posts made in the religion forum that are always given as reasons for me being about to be banned.

Easyrider: I don't get quite that many warnings, but if a group who hates the message of Christ and those who bring it flood Admin with enough complaints about every little thing, then the warnings come regardless. 

 
 Just for the record, I have not complained to moderators about anyone. 
 
 
EasyRider: I've been told me and my God can go straight to hell ..

 
 And scores of us have been told by you that we will go straight to hell.
 
 
EasyRider: ... been told I should be out killing gays,

 
 I am sorry you don't like what YOUR Lord and Savior Jesus Christ DEMAND that you do. It's in the Bible: you know, the Word of God you base your entire way of living on.

I suspect it's more a matter of tone and respect than specific things you've said, but I don't think you've done anything to warrant outright being banned. And you haven't been banned, since you're still here.
 
 But I do think the admins here do a good job of encouraging people to keep things civil. I appreciate that, myself.

Well, I'm generally in DamEtel's camp, but I think he has gone a bit too far.
 
 Lok, DamEtel, try to lower your aggression levels. That's all. You keep coming out with all cannons blazing. That's the problem. 
 
 We all know the other side gets really annoying at times, heck, I get urges to smack Easyrider just about every three posts of his I read.
 
 What you need is simply to stop being so aggressive. Switch strategies. Become a dignified pillar of imperturbability. That way, you won't turn people against yourself, AND you'll make everyone else that loses his temper look all the worse.

BAN HIM!!!
 
 
 
 Lol, joking! No one should be banned for anything said about the above mentioned. People who complain are just mad you don't agree with their views. emoticon_xgood 
 
 I don't think they'll ban ya!
17 no 2 yes and Steeeeve, Jyoshu, Jp, and Jim's Trucking have yet to vote. Hummm I wonder on which side they will come down on?

 I didn't vote because the poll was closed.

I should be surprised if anyone was banned from this forum by "popular vote". 
 
 In my opinion, for what it's worth, I don't think anything (that I've read) posted by either Easyrider or DamEtel would justify a ban. They use intemperate language to express their opinions from time to time - but religion can excite a passionate exchange of views, and we should make allowances for that.
 
 I'm more impatient with the hi-jacking of threads by single issue enthusiasts or with interesting discussions going off at absurd tangents.

In my opinion, for what it's worth, I don't think anything (that I've read) posted by either Easyrider or DamEtel would justify a ban. They use intemperate language to express their opinions from time to time - but religion can excite a passionate exchange of views, and we should make allowances for that.
I don't know if much exchanging goes on. Religion can also cause people to shout at each other with their fingers in their ears. 
 
 On the other hand, that's not really a banning offence.

I don't know if much exchanging goes on. Religion can also cause people to shout at each other with their fingers in their ears. 
 
 On the other hand, that's not really a banning offence.

 
 Yes, refusing to listen is a big problem in some exchanges here, and a kind of competition in belligerence seems to take the place of civil discourse. 
 
 But there's always a chance that somebody will come into the thread and make a sagacious point that takes the discussion back (or on) to a place at which it can deviate into sense.
You are agressive in your attitude Dametal. And you problems with religon can even offend the more rational spiritual types here.

Hmm, strange.
 
 
 
Thank you for your remarks and I appreciate what you said, about sticking around, etc. And I appreciate that you have been reasonable and not out of line in your postings. Things do get heated sometimes.
 
 Thanks...
You're welcome. Difference of opinion is essential to such a place. We all just need to remember to keep things civil from time to time!

There should be a third choice. The question in the thread title relates to recorded actions of DamEtel. The two poll choices relate to judgement against DamEtel.
 
 A third choice should be listed: I am not aware of any infractions deserving bannishment. That's my true feeling on the matter. Given the two choices, I must say "no".
 
 Frankly, I prefer no-holds-barred discussions wherein crybabies have no recourse but to shut up and read the posts of those whose balls are big enough to say what they truly think. I see that from both sides on occasion...it's just that some people are entirely polite and others are not. I prefer thick skinned warriors who laugh off insults and attribute them to the incompetency of the attacker.
 
 I think nobody should be banned. I believe in true freedom of speech. I visit another forum (where candy asses fear to tread) where politeness is not required and I have no problem with insults, though many are directed at me. My return volleys are generally exceedingly insulting.
 
 This forum, however teaches one to be polite and use the same courtesy as would be expected in a court room. I like the challenge.

I would like to go on the record here, I am a conservative and christian. However I voted he should not be banned. 
 
 Why, because
 
 First off, so what if he likes to go in cannons blazing, we all feel like it at times. It is up to whoever he is debating with at the time to ignore him or not. 
 
 Secondly, so what if he has opposing viewpoints, and really likes to debate them. The whole reason there are sites like this are to have opposing viewpoints. (He has diff views than me, but I don't want him to go). 
 
 Thirdly,we are all mature enough to take a few choice words here and there. On national television I here many words, but that doesn't mean we fire the actor.
 
 However it is completely up to how the admin wants his site ran. If the admin doesn't want certain words to be said, than it is up to the admin to ban. I just hope that he isn't being kicked off for his oppinions.
 
 I have an idea. I think when the admin finds he wants to ban someone he should put it up for a vote and see what the people want.

I didn't vote because the poll was closed.

 
 
 Is it may 15th yet? The poll is open until may 15th, 2006 at 4pm

I suspect that every one of them is being unreasonable and it had nothing to do with your individual behavior. I just want to know what the rules are and have a level playing field. If the rules are you can curse someone out, then that's fine with me too, as long as I know in advance and can get a (non-cursing) blast in too once in a while, ha ha.

 I have been reading most of your post since way back at USA Today and NYTimes . . . 2001. 
 
 I remember the unlevel playing field from day one. God as my witness, some how, some one/bot even got in a few very profane words through the filter at me at one of those forums, which I will not name. I know they were not cursing at me. God in me really enraged someone, no doubt.

Sounds awful. If I wanted a slagging match I could go down the local boozer on a Friday and have a row about politics with some p*ssed up lout there.
 
 Personally I prefer things with a little more decorum.
I too prefer civilized dialog, debate and open discussion...gentlemanly behavior, so to speak. However, there are many educated ruffians in this world who deserve to be heard and responded to despite their lack of manners. In doing so, it is 'polite' to let them know that their foul language and personal attacks are expected and shall be returned in kind so that they fully understand their equal standing amongst the valued participants. There are also occasions where lessons are slowly absorbed by those 'crude' people and their language gradually changes for the better. Banning them only makes them more angry.
 
 In the world of 'treat me as you want to be treated', I swing back with a heavy stick at those who dare curse me.
 
 DamEtel can't hold a candle to some who have been banned from here for relentless non-sense. His attitude is somewhat irritating at times and I seldom bother to verify his quoted scripture as I am aware that the Bible can be used to justify both sides of many controversial questions. While he hasn't totally avoided name calling and appears to have an endless supply of needling questions, some of which seem meant to be so, he should be welcome to speak his mind, feeble as it may be. Each time he does, his opponents garner more respect from me for putting up with his :xcensored !

First, I do not think DamEtal needs to be banned. However DamEtal should learn to actually argue as opposed to criticize. To simply complain about something is not argument. 
 
 Religion is a hotbutton issue for many. Attacks on people are simply unacceptable. Argument that is solid argument is what this site is about. I to, have been warned about my conduct for things also not worthy, in my opinion. But, we are guests on private property and the owners have a right to do as THEY see fit.
